resources.title: 5-Minute Grounding Technique
resources.content:
The 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding Technique

This exercise helps you stay present when anxiety takes over. Follow these steps:

5 THINGS YOU CAN SEE
Look around and name 5 things you can see. Focus on small details.

4 THINGS YOU CAN TOUCH
Notice the texture of your clothes, the smoothness of your desk, the temperature of the air.

3 THINGS YOU CAN HEAR
Listen carefully - maybe a clock ticking, traffic outside, or your own breathing.

2 THINGS YOU CAN SMELL
This might require you to move around. Notice any scents in your environment.

1 THING YOU CAN TASTE
What does your mouth taste like right now? Notice the sensation.

Repeat this exercise whenever you feel overwhelmed. It brings your mind back to the present moment and interrupts the anxiety spiral.

resources.title: How to Practice Self-Care
resources.content:
Self-Care Isn't Selfish

Self-care is about taking deliberate actions to maintain your physical, mental, and emotional health. Here's a practical guide:

PHYSICAL SELF-CARE
• Get 7-9 hours of sleep
• Move your body daily (even a 10-min walk counts)
• Eat nourishing meals
• Stay hydrated

EMOTIONAL SELF-CARE
• Journal your thoughts
• Set healthy boundaries
• Allow yourself to feel emotions
• Practice positive self-talk

SOCIAL SELF-CARE
• Connect with supportive friends
• Ask for help when needed
• Limit time with draining people

MENTAL SELF-CARE
• Take breaks from screens
• Learn something new
• Practice mindfulness
• Declutter your space

Remember: You can't pour from an empty cup. Taking care of yourself enables you to show up better for others.

resources.title: Building Mental Resilience
resources.content:
Building Mental Resilience

Resilience is the ability to bounce back from setbacks. Here's how to build it:

1. REFRAME NEGATIVE THOUGHTS
When something goes wrong, ask: 'What can I learn from this?' instead of 'Why does this always happen to me?'

2. BUILD A SUPPORT NETWORK
Strong relationships provide emotional support during tough times. Invest in authentic connections.

3. PRACTICE SELF-COMPASSION
Treat yourself with the same kindness you'd show a good friend facing difficulties.

4. SET REALISTIC GOALS
Break big challenges into smaller, achievable steps. Celebrate small wins.

5. MAINTAIN PERSPECTIVE
Ask yourself: 'Will this matter in 5 years?' Most stressors are temporary.

6. TAKE CARE OF YOUR BODY
Physical health directly impacts mental resilience. Prioritize sleep, exercise, and nutrition.

Resilience isn't about avoiding stress—it's about learning to navigate it effectively.
